website_summaries.verdict: A convenient and well-made pack of 3 wraps, best suited for small-medium dogs.
pros: Adjustable hook-and-loop strap allows you to loosen or tighten the wrap according to your dogs needs
Wraps are easy to clean and are safe to put in the dryer
Sold in convenient packs of 3, so you can rotate through clean wraps, without having to wait through the washing cycle
Surprising longevity for packaged wraps – they should last you about 2-3 years
cons: Any exposed loops may stick to couches, blankets, and other materials

customer_reviews.title: Saved My Sanity
customer_reviews.text: Didn't know why my 1 year old boy felt he needed to pee on people's feet. Then found out they nearly all had cats. Perfectly fit my sheltie who's almost 30 pounds. He walks kind of funny when it first goes on. No one is allowed to laugh at him (openly). Then he forgets all about it. Not too sure he even knows he is peeing. Looks more like a corset than a diaper. Works great with liner or without. No problems with the washing machine & dryer. I would buy this again. Very inexpensive compared to buying shoes for other people.
customer_reviews.author: DawnsFolly

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! They don’t bother my pug and they stay out! It’s a miracle. He absolutely cannot get them off due to the strong Velcro. The Velcro is strong and a little stuff which I didn’t like at first but it makes them escape proof. They bunch a little but don’t slip off his “junk” so my furniture is protected. He comes to me on occasion, looking ashamed and walking funny cause he peed his pants. It helped when my female pug was in heat because he couldn’t get to her, but I wouldn’t trust them for doggie birth control in general. I’m definitely going to buy more of these awesome wraps!!
customer_reviews.author: SJordan

customer_reviews.title: My dog has cancer and besides incontinence he's still fine! Peppy
customer_reviews.text: My dog has cancer and besides incontinence he's still fine! Peppy, hungry, happy. These bands have been a life saver because he pees constantly. I put an incontinence pad or a sanitary napkin and change them throughout the day between times he goes out and it's all good. I sincerely appreciate the elastic sides which prevents leakage with the pads. For people complaining about various issues it has to do with using pads and the elastic being too tight because they chose the wrong size. It's a fantastic invention really!
customer_reviews.author: Dragon-FoxTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: A Great Belt For Male Dogs
customer_reviews.text: Adopted a "thrown away stray" who has a problem with marking in the house.While he waiting for his neutering appointment at the vet he has been wearing one of these while inside the house. It has been a great product for us and him, it fits him well and he doesn`t mind wearing it a bit. By using a panty liner inside the belt there have been no leakage incidents and the belt stays dry and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Linus69

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold very much at all
customer_reviews.text: It does not absorb much at all except maybe a little and it soaks through getting everything else (including your dog) wet, too. My dog is 16 and is having issues being able to wait till I get home from work. If your dog doesn't do more than pee a tiny bit when it gets excited, then its good. The diaper itself is not too tight so its not bad there. Its also easy to clean and easy on and off. Wouldn't buy again. I recommend wegreeco as it holds a lot.
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Holds up well.
customer_reviews.text: Great item. Works perfectly with a sanitary napkins. My elderly, incontinent dog wears these 24/7 almost and they hold up for months with frequent washing. I also use bleach to eliminate the urine smells and they do not color fade. Velcro holds up as expected and will collect fuzz over time. Wish there were other color options too. Large does run LARGE though so for those in between size dogs you may have to fold it over and sew it a bit to shorten it.
customer_reviews.author: C.S.

customer_reviews.title: the belcrow much better for pups and the garter not as tight
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed but sizes are off. I bought the small size for my 9lbs maltese based on its label description. Garter was tight (despite belcrow adjustments I did) on my pup that it left a red mark across his penis which i was concerned about his skin getting irritated. Band was not wide enough to at least cover the lenght of the dogs penis. I did not return it because i have used it already so I tried another brand instead called wegreeco in sz small and the band was wider, the belcrow much better for pups and the garter not as tight, i got a set of three for a cheaper price.
customer_reviews.author: Markus

customer_reviews.title: Diapers get wet inside and out. Furniture, bedding, etc may still get some urine on them.
customer_reviews.text: The sizing was accurate for both of my dogs, but even with a thin liner these get soaked through and still get furniture, bedding, etc wet often. One of my dogs has kidney damage so he is having incontinence. Unless he only goes a small amount and only gets urine on the liner, the diaper is wet inside and out. I read that it's suppose to get better with repeated washes, but that is not the case. It causes less irritation than disposable diapers, so that's a positive, but it does not prevent leaks as well as disposables. It's too bad I bought several before finding out they soak through.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Really A Simple Solution!
customer_reviews.text: I have a rescued poodle that has never been properly potty trained and will mark all over the place. I started using these wraps for the last 5-6 years now and they work great! They are easy to put on and take off and my dog does not mind wearing them and cannot get them off. I wash them daily and dry them and they last forever! I purchased the larger size for another dog and they did well with him also! These are great for male dogs that mark and very easy to use! (Update: I still purchase these for my dog and they last a long time! Even when washed daily!)
customer_reviews.author: 3DogMOM

customer_reviews.title: Sun Man Says THANK YOU!
customer_reviews.text: Sun Man says THANK YOU!!! Today Sunny is 20 years old, and sometimes we all can use a little help. We've tried other "doggie diapers" styles, and had to give up after they all failed... badly. It was just chance to see this brand on Amazon last week, and thought we'd try just one more time. Sooo grateful we did too! It fits perfectly. It's breathable, so he's not too hot with it on, and the sizing was spot on, (yes pun intended). Sun Man's a good bud for two decades now. He's guarded my home with his life and my heart with his soul. Am so grateful for anything that can help make this chapter of his life easier.
customer_reviews.author: EtO

customer_reviews.title: Been using this product for 4+ years!
customer_reviews.text: We have used this brand of washable "diaper" for years on our little Yorkie to wear when we leave for work during the day, as he is so small and can't hold his bladder for 8 hours. After 4 years we still have and use the 3 original wraps we bought, just finally got around to ordering more. We told up a little toilet paper and it helps soaks up the urine, he doesn't mind wearing them a bit!
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Trimble

customer_reviews.title: Great wrap!
customer_reviews.text: Our dog's waist is about 23 inches and this wrap fits him well (he's a boxer pit bull mix, about 53 pounds). The wrap works well by itself, but I also use these in conjunction with a disposable diaper... Sometimes he gets out of the diaper, so this one holds it on and provides extra protection for when he pees (and I don't have to wash the reusable wraps every time they're used then). I'm a much happier pup mom now using diapers and belly bands for my dog and not having to clean up pee off the floor every day!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: this wrap does not absorb liquid terribly well. This wrap is easy to handwash
customer_reviews.text: For my dog with a strong, unfortunate persistence to mark his indoor territory, this product is helpful but not adequate by itself. You have to put a self-adhesive pad inside. I use pads made for human incontinence. This product is just a convenient way to keep the pad on the dog. On its own, this wrap does not absorb liquid terribly well. This wrap is easy to handwash; it can be airdried or put in dryer on delicates setting. If the wrap does get some urine on it, though, it is hard to eradicate the urine odor.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy C. Casey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I have a dog that has become incontinent. I use these over Simple Solutions male wraps. Since doing so I have had no leaks even under heavy urination overnight. These are soft and flexible and my dog did not mind wearing them at all. I purchased 2 in total. So if the first one becomes dirty from wear, I have the second to put on right away. I highly recommend these. My dog measured as 18", I purchased the medium. They fit well around his middle so there is no leaking. However, I am at the out edge of both sides of the velcro so when I order another I will try a large.
customer_reviews.author: ddaly

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: My male dog is such a little jerk and loves to mark ALL over our house. I'm so glad I found these, they are the only thing saving our house from being disgusting. I ordered two and I feel like I need at least one or two more, they are awesome but he always pees in them it's hard to keep up with only two. I don't know exactly how much he pees in this, but it's always heavier when i take it off and it has had no leaking problems. I would definitely recommend this product and seller, it came in right on time.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah B.

customer_reviews.title: quality product, but not for "Plus-sized dogs"
customer_reviews.text: This is a nicely constructed quality product. I have little doubt that it works very well. One big problem - it says on the label and on website that it stretches to support a 35" waist. It doesn't - not even close. The most this fabric will stretch to is 30". But if you tried to put it on an animal with a 30" waist, it would be so tight as to cut off blood flow. Also, you'll have a real struggle trying to get it on. If your animal has anything larger than about a 28" waist, this contraption isn't for you. If your animal is smaller, this looks like a fine solution to a piddle-problem.
customer_reviews.author: Hollis Tibbetts

customer_reviews.title: great for male dogs
customer_reviews.text: These are great!! Had a bit of a fix on the size, so I would measure my dog and then go up a size perhaps. He is a chihuahua, but ended up needing a medium. I love that it can be washed, since the paper ones are expensive over the long haul. Also, you might want to use a feminine pad inside for extra absorption; some nights he doesn't wet it, so I have it for a few days. When he does wet, I just rinse it out in the kitchen sink with a little soap and by night the wrap is dry and ready for bedtime. It fits comfortably without leaking, and the velcro is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie J. Grant

customer_reviews.title: Just created a new spot to clean
customer_reviews.text: Not super absorbent or leak proof. The wrap is getting saturated all the way through and leaving a wet spot where my dog is laying. The sizing on the package is also different than what’s written here. My dog has a 20” waist, medium is listed as 20-22”, but the package I received says 13-21”. It fits VERY snug and leaves red marks on his skin. I would not purchase this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: melissa braden

customer_reviews.title: Not even close...
customer_reviews.text: to being "leak proof" or even leak resistant. If I don't keep an eye on my boy, I will find a dark stain on his diaper letting me know that it has leaked through. I even reinforce the diaper with a "super" absorbent feminine napkin. As far as cleaning them, to get rid of the odor, I soak them in baking soda before putting them in the wash.
customer_reviews.author: Chauncy123

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: When my old dog developed a tumor on his brain, he couldn't remember some basic things such as potty training and he started having "accidents" around the house. I tried disposable diapers, but they are expensive. I decided to get this as an alternative. It fit him well and seemed to be more comfortable that the disposable ones. My advice would be to purchase a few of these and some panty liners to go inside. This way the panty liners soak up the urine and you have a backup if it gets wet.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany M. Reed

customer_reviews.title: These were a little better at solving the problem
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after trying their "Simple solutions" disposable training pads and doggy diapers with little success. These were a little better at solving the problem, but not great. I measured his waist carefully but they definitely run small. My pup really didn't like them because of the elastic and given their width it was sometimes difficult to get all his "junk" inside the band. I wound up very successfully solving the problem with non-elastic male wraps that I bought on eBay (but very similar ones are now being sold on Amazon). The two star rating reflects that this helped me along the continuum of solving my pup's problem, but was not a very useful product in and of itself.
customer_reviews.author: cookie cutter

customer_reviews.title: Great for Preventing Marking
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend these for males that have dribbles or are marking in the house. ONLY use them when you cannot watch them. (I use them at night on occasion) Washable and you can use any absorbent material that is disposable inside to reduce times you need to wash. DO NOT LEAVE THIS ON YOUR DOG IF THEY PEE A LOT, IT CAN CAN CAUSE LOTS OF PROBLEMS. These also helped GREATLY when my corgi had bladder surgery for stones.. He had a catheter in for 3 days and I had to take care of him by draining his bladder every hour. The bands helped keep the catheter in place and kept him from itching or messing with his incision.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: Last for years
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this back in 2012 (it is now 2018) for my senior dog who could no longer control his bladder due to health issues. He passed away four years ago, and now I have another dog of the same breed who has health issues (does not realize when he has to pee) and I am still using the same wraps. They are holding up great and while they are starting to show some wear, they still work great!
customer_reviews.author: HobbsGal

customer_reviews.title: Good Deterent
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased a few of these. They last a long time, and have been through many washings. When my dog wears this belly-band, he barks when he needs to go out. I usually only make him wear then when it's cold or raining outside. Often, without it, he will sneak off and find a place to pee in the house. The belly band is elastic so it stays on him. The velcro is very tough. My dog does occasionally have accidents. The belly-band does an "okay" job at absorbing it, but it still goes through. It is a better deterrent, than a diaper.
customer_reviews.author: JV

customer_reviews.title: Great Solution for a Spiteful Pee-er
customer_reviews.text: Our dog is a jerk and likes to pee on anything that he feels like is in his way or crowding his life somehow. We've not been letting him into the main part of the house which is sad because that cuts down majorly on socialization time for him. So I got him this "Weenie Wrap" and it's great! He can be a jerk all he wants and it won't affect us at all!
customer_reviews.author: Angela T

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for discouraging "marking"
customer_reviews.text: I buy these to discourage my male dog from peeing in the house at night while we are sleeping. They are just enough to remind him that he's not allowed to mark in the house. While we are gone we have to use the disposable diapers if we don't put him in his crate because then he'll pee constantly and he needs for absorption that this one. But this works perfect for his nightly diaper. I did deduct one star just because they seem to stretch more than they used too and I am buying them a little more frequently now. I still would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah *Smiles*

customer_reviews.title: Doggie Wraps A Must
customer_reviews.text: No one wants to have to buy this necessarily, but I had to buy this for my aging dog. He did not love this wrapped around his lower area and it was snug, but very elastic. I put a pad in it to make sure there was not a big mess and he did okay with it. He seemed a little uncomfortable, but maybe that was because it was in an odd place. The concept seemed to work, though. I would recommend it to people with dogs that have incontinence problems. The seller shipped this super fast and it was packaged well. I could not recommend a transaction with this seller more!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Delamar-Goss

customer_reviews.title: The gathered edges are irritating to the dog and leaves the area between the gathered sides as a huge amount of fabric and sits a good inch or so away from the dog
customer_reviews.text: I have a 58# boxer. The medium is way too tight and the large is huge (slips down). The sizing is off (although the concept is great). The other problem is it needs to fit more flat against the dog. The gathered edges are irritating to the dog and leaves the area between the gathered sides as a huge amount of fabric and sits a good inch or so away from the dog. I'm back using the female version (which also has the same sizing problem, with medium way too small and large way too big).
customer_reviews.author: brmsy

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. I went with a large, worried that a med would be too small. The elastic all along the edges makes it so that even though it may be a bit big, there is no leaking. I put a diaper insert in it, from a package of dog dippers I tried that were too small. Our old dog has not tried to chew it or take it off.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad product...
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this to be as good as the disposable wraps for males or as good as the female washable diapers. The only thing this is missing is more velcro so, you can adjust the sizing. I have a large German Shepherd but, he's skinny... unfortunately this doesn't fit correctly or hold in place like the disposable ones do. I am using safety pins to hold it in place but it bunches up..
customer_reviews.author: Jaquellie todd

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended wraps.
customer_reviews.text: These go on easily & stay in place. The M size works for my 14 lb. dog. I buy the Advantage brand guard pads for adult male incontinence (rated for Max absorption) & place them in these wraps and they work great! The pads cost $9.50 for 52 @ WM and they are self-adhesive so they stay put. The wraps are easy to hand wash in a sink & dry in air. So I got 2 of these - 1 for the daytime & 1 for night. As long as the pads aren't saturated (and they hold a lot!), the wraps will not be wetted w/ urine and won't need washing.
customer_reviews.author: Janis Starkman

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, functions perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a few different brands of male wraps and this one is the best. The Velcro provides just the right amount of stick and these things are crazy durable. I close the Velcro before putting them in the wash. I also use them with disposable liners most of the time. Others I've tried slip around my dog's body, or the Velcro is so strong I can barely open it. I buy only these now.
customer_reviews.author: Jumpin

customer_reviews.title: Good for old dog.
customer_reviews.text: My border collie is very old, going blind and a bit deaf, and I crate him for his own safety when I have to be away from the house. The only time he has trouble with incontinence is when I come home and he gets so excited that he can't hold it. I use one of the heaviest human incontinence pads to line these belly wraps and that solves the problem of having to disinfect his crate and wash bedding every time I leave him. These are soft with just enough stretch so I think he's comfortable. They are durable in the wash. I recommend them highly.
customer_reviews.author: BGE

customer_reviews.title: Priceless product
customer_reviews.text: Our dog was diagnosed with prostrate cancer and having some accidents in our home. This wrap was easy to put on and take off. Since my dog is tiny, I added a maxi pad wth wings inside the wrap, so I didn't have to rinse it after each accident and it was a perfect fit inside the wrap. I encourage you to do the same. It was durable for hand and machine washing. I bought 2 so I could always have a clean, dry one. It also seems to make my dog feel less apt to have an accident in the home. Highly recommend. Other wraps in leg stores are fav more pricey, too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Other than that the wrap itself seems pretty good. Just buy it in a bigger size
customer_reviews.text: The packaging looked so similar to the top paw male wrap that I ordered it thinking it was the same, it was not. This is made smaller than the top paw brand, so it did not fit my dog. I ordered the medium and I have a toy poodle who weighs ten pounds and it did not fit him. I had already thrown away the packaging before I realized the deception, which would prevent me from returning it, otherwise I would. Other than that the wrap itself seems pretty good. Just buy it in a bigger size.
customer_reviews.author: Eppy

customer_reviews.title: Saved my sanity!!
customer_reviews.text: This little wrap has saved my sanity! My new little guy is being VERY stubborn with his potty training, and frankly I was getting pretty tired of cleaning wee-wee off the floor. We call this his cumberbund and surprisingly, it's actually helping with the potty training! I think it makes him more aware and mindful of letting me know that he needs to go outside when he's got to "go". I HIGHLY recommend this product!!
customer_reviews.author: Elizajane

customer_reviews.title: Very durable, but you need a liner or pad
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using these for my hard headed Yorkie for years! The are very durable and wash great in the washing machine. They are not leak proof. We buy poise pads for adults and use them to line his diaper. It gives us several wears before we have to wash. I have tried others and the quality does not compare.
customer_reviews.author: Paisley W.

customer_reviews.title: This was for a 10 lb male dog, it ...
customer_reviews.text: This was for a 10 lb male dog, it was way too small. We still had another 2 inches to go before it would close. Just as expensive to return as the item. It states it is for up to a 19 inch waist...even if you stretch it as far as the band goes it is only 17.5 inches. Not buying a medium for fear it would be too large. Don't trust the size chart.
customer_reviews.author: Naper mom

customer_reviews.title: Love the Simple Solution wrap over those "other" belly bands.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the Simple Solution brand for my elderly toy poodle. He has accidents more frequently. I like this brand because they are ever so slightly wider than those you find (that look similar) in the chain pets tires. That helps with leaks. It is also big enough and stretchy enough that I can add a thick pad inside for those moments he just can't make it to the door. It fits him comfortably and, although he gets teased by his human family for wearing a "tutu," he is comfortable, happy, and my rugs are safe.
customer_reviews.author: B. Radacs

customer_reviews.title: An O.K. Wrap
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several of these here and they work reasonably well. I started with the Medium size based on my dog' s measurements, but had to go to the Large for adequate room for the Poise pads I use. The Large is a bit droopy, but it is more comfy for my dog. The wrap's "absorbent" lining is useless if the pad is drenched. I had one wrap that the elastic on one side broke the first time it was washed. Thankfully, it failed in the first 30 days and Amazon replaced it immediately. However, this wrap is far better than the Vet's Best brand I started with.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B.

customer_reviews.title: This is awesome.. we have a male who is young ...
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome..we have a male who is young and who will inevitably lift his leg. We don't want to keep him away from the others but also don't want a house that smells of using. This band is great..fits well and is washable. As others have stated I have found that buying sanitary napkins with the wings are the best liner, much cheaper and hold on very well. We love this belly band!
customer_reviews.author: Rolf

customer_reviews.title: this review may save you time and money
customer_reviews.text: I have an unaltered French Bulldog and I've tried many male wraps. This one is by far the best, here's why: Fabric is soft with just the right amount of elastic to keep it on and urine from escaping. There are a few added layers of fabric in the right spot just in case the pad shifts. I would highly recommend using adult male urinary incontinent pads because they are meant for the correct anatomy, are thicker and also have elastic to prevent leaks to the wrap and beyond and cheaper! If you decide to use these instead of dog or female pads, order the wrap in one size up. Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: KLM

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Many reviews on the lining coming apart or getting frayed. After one washing, and 1 drying every single day, I guess so. I have had this wrap for about a month and its still going strong. Just a little fraying, but that's because of the dryer. The wrap alone will not stop leaks. I have an 80-90 pound dog who leaks a little yet I put three pads inside to help. One pad is not enough. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: mrteetd

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, keeps my dog dry all night long
customer_reviews.text: Finally, no more wet floor or carpet while my dog is sleeping. This really does keep the urine within the wrap and away from the dog's fur. The medium size fits my miniature American Eskimoe just fine. He weighs about 15 lbs. The package instructions say that the more you wash this, the more absorbent it becomes. I believe that it has. I hand wash with a little detergent, rinse, then dry in dryer. I do this every morning, so that is why I am ordering a second one.
customer_reviews.author: KrafteKaryn

customer_reviews.title: It's frustrating when dogs don't fit big size discrepancies like this, but I guess it works fine enough
customer_reviews.text: I guess these would work, though the size is off. My dog, admittedly, has usually been between S and M in most cases, but I did measure him and still this small wrap was so small that I worried about his circulation. He wore it one day and peed in it, so I can't return it, of course. I bought a medium at a local big box store and it's too big, so I had to sew it to be smaller. It's frustrating when dogs don't fit big size discrepancies like this, but I guess it works fine enough. I probably will donate this one to a shelter.
customer_reviews.author: A. Rush

customer_reviews.title: Great wraps worth some additions to absorb more completely.
customer_reviews.text: These reusable dog wraps are wonderful. I do put another maxi pad inside the wrap to absorb. If I didn't, the wraps would leak. I keep 2 clean and one on the dog at all times inside. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: kyglo

customer_reviews.title: Male wrap in large
customer_reviews.text: I have a Basset Hound (49 pounds) I bought the large and it fits well. The material is soft but slick. My boy tends to roll around sleeping either upside down or on his side and this wrap tends to move with him. It it not always in the best position to catch the urine ( the liner helps with this). It is still better than nothing. I have not tried the liners they sell for the wrap yet because I am cutting up the doggie diapers that were the wrong size to use as a liner. I recommend keeping several wraps on hand. I also have bought rubber/flannel sheeting for under places he lays. This helps tremendously.
customer_reviews.author: Rodeobelle

customer_reviews.title: My dog is too big for a small and too small for a medium but the product is well made otherwise
customer_reviews.text: This is fine, it's great quality and takes an incontinence pad nicely. The only problem is that my Rat Terrier, about 22 pounds, wearing a size medium, can get this off. He had a size small in another brand and it is too tight and I'm pretty sure that Simple Solutions' size small would be too tight as well because their Medium is the same size as my dog's Medium. I wish there was something just a bit smaller than the Medium they make. Otherwise, it's a great product.
customer_reviews.author: just wondering

customer_reviews.title: Use in conjunction with incontinence pads.
customer_reviews.text: I have an old dog with dementia who has forgotten his potty training. So he has to wear one of these all the time now. For anyone thinking of buying them, note that they are not very absorbent. The urine will go right through them. So I put a lady's incontinence pad inside the wrap and it soaks up most of the urine. The wrap still gets wet though and needs to be changed. So I had to buy a bunch of these so I am not washing them every other day. They are a bandaid for the issue - but they could work a little better.
customer_reviews.author: Bambi_Unbridled

customer_reviews.title: Excellent results after trying many other types!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for about 3 years. I originally bought these for my diabetic terrier - I had tried several brands an types of belly bands and had little success. But these wraps are better. And forget about using the diaper liners, or maxi pads; get the urinary incontinence pads sold in Walmart - "Options" is the brand and they come in several lengths and thicknesses. They really capture the urine and they have small elasticized sides to help keep leakage to a minimum. Definitely get several bands because they will eventually get some urine on them and get stinky, and you definitely need to keep your pet clean so he doesn't get an irritation or infection.
customer_reviews.author: JeanneTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and protects from marking.
customer_reviews.text: My dog is about 30 libs, German Spitz/ AKA American Eskimo dog. He is a prolific marker. Fits great and prevents my dog from marking indoors! I like it a lot. It is substantial and doesn't leak. Obviously not for heavy peeing. That would be a diaper product. I make sure to take him for a short walk so he can pee properly before we go into our host's home or indoors. The velco is wide enough to allow for some adjustment. I'm going to buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Saves our floors
customer_reviews.text: We've purchased a total of 6 of these now for our dogs. We had a prior dog that had diabetes which caused him to urinate a lot and he wouldn't always let us know when he had to go. We now have another dog with Lime disease that is also having the same kind of urination issue. Using these with human "incontinence pads" (such as Poise) inserted in them helps us keep our floors dry. However, he manages to sometimes shift the pad in such a way that it doesn't always catch everything and there is still a puddle to clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: great material well built
customer_reviews.text: great material well built, easy to put around our rescue's waist line. unfortunately the dog would fight it off and wanted to go free ballin'. As soon as i put it around him he would take it off and run from me if i tried to put it back on him. :-( he has enlarged prostate from not being fixed and his prostate puts pressure on his bladder causing incontinance. We fixed him and im hoping with time prostate goes down. I was hoping i can put this item around his waiste so i wouldn't have to mop so much But he fights it off.
customer_reviews.author: Arezoo G.

customer_reviews.title: hate it
customer_reviews.text: i believe my size choice was correct, but its just not easy to use. the side elastic is really taught making it difficult to stretch around and fasten, esp if dog is moving/resisting. also its not waterproof, so the exterior was always wet. i bought handmade belly bands on ebay that were super awesome instead. this is better priced than some pet stores, but i wouldnt recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Dena Cuellar

customer_reviews.title: He is pretty small. He weighs 8 lbs and the small ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I had to buy a wrap for my old man chihuahua. He is pretty small. He weighs 8 lbs and the small is too small. It would not for a 19" waist comfortably. Because it's too tight I had to buy new ones. It worked for the time in between but I would suggest ordering a size up.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for our pup’s issue
customer_reviews.text: Our 17 year old has a growth that hangs from her stomach and unfortunately is too old for surgury so we needed something to help hold that up and this has worked incredibly well! She’s able to walk so much better with the weight lifted. It might not be what the intent for this is for but it’s worked.
customer_reviews.author: _steev_o_

customer_reviews.title: Bad sores and worse walking
customer_reviews.text: They seriously hindered my dog's gait. My senior dog already has trouble with his back end, and trouble walking, but since he's been wearing this and when he wears this his gait is extremely worse. :( Also, the material along the edges is not conducive to my dog's skins wellbeing. It caused him sores all over where the elastic is. We got adult diapers instead and now he doesn't have either of the problems these things caused. He walks better now and his sores are getting better since we STOPPED using this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: They run on the small size for some breeds
customer_reviews.text: The large wasn't large enough for my 14 y.o. Belgian Tervuren He's 68# & lean. The belly band was too tight & pinching him -- he was not comfortable. Trying to locate an EXTRA LARGE is proving difficult. I think I will just make my own custom fit.
customer_reviews.author: Susan H.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have more than a dozen of these. I use a thin feminine pad as a liner. They wash well and have held up well. I velcro them and wash them inside out, usually hang to dry. I have been using these for the last several years for my male inside dog who would not stop marking after we brought a spayed female to the family. Lifesaver!
customer_reviews.author: PeggyG

customer_reviews.title: Eh...
customer_reviews.text: I have a heftier chihuahua who is a little older now and can't hold his bladder as long as he used to. We tried putting this on him; however, he had the skill to wiggle out of it and as embarrassing as this is to admit, his anatomy is a little smaller than most, so the wrap didn't work as expected; he kept missing. I can't say the actual product was the only problem, there were many factors that caused me to dislike it, so I can't say I do not recommend; however, for my experience, if I had known, I would've not bought the product.
customer_reviews.author: TanGBo21

customer_reviews.title: I got this for my good ol' boy who in his old age has begun ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my good ol' boy who in his old age has begun to deal with slight incontinence issues. I've been using this belly band on him for a couple weeks now and while it stays in place it has actually caused his skin to break where the lining is sinched. He now has open wounds on both sides of his underbelly. I bought the size based on weight recommendation but I would go up a size since the belt is so tight. I feel horrible for my boy. Now I am stuck with a belly band that hurts him and no answer for the incontinence.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Loomis

customer_reviews.title: Like other reviewers stated
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviewers stated, this product needs an absorbent pad of some sort. Our dog doesn't just have a little sprinkle, he has a full on accident and this wrap alone does nothing to contain that. We have been using human incontinence pads, cut to fit. Actually the best ones have been human incontinence pads with a sticky bottom although we have to put two of them in there to cover the entire width. Still cheaper to purchase this item and human diapers or pads then to purchase the dog disposable wraps.
customer_reviews.author: Julian

customer_reviews.title: A great fit
customer_reviews.text: We use these for our old guy—he has Addison’s disease and drinks/pees a lot. This keeps him from peeing in the house in the middle of the night and while we are at work/school. Easy to get on and off. Easy to wash.
customer_reviews.author: Kellie Harding

customer_reviews.title: Simple & Effective
customer_reviews.text: I have a 10 year old male yorkie who weighs 10 lbs and the medium suited him perfectly. My dog normally marks his territory all around my apartment (on every furniture edge, table legs, etc) and I normally wake up to about a dozen small puddles scattered around the living room. This wrap is comfortable enough that my dog has made no attempt to maneuver his way out of it and seems to even forget that he's wearing it and the best part is that there have been no puddles in sight! This wrap is well made, comfortable and it works!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Not that great
customer_reviews.text: Our elderly Chihuahua has recently developed incontinence problems and after checking things out with the vet, we are trying different products on him to try to save our furniture/carpet/etc. Our short-haired (rather slick fur) Chihuahua is 7 lbs and the small just barely wraps around him, and the exposed velcro ends up snagging on everything and he is constantly able to get it off. The medium is gigantic on him. On top of that, the material just bunches up on him, so it never sits comfortably on his 'masculinity'. I like the other wraps made of neoprene better.
customer_reviews.author: sweetpea

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed for our senior Westie
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad that I ordered this for our 16 year old Westie. He has begun to have accidents lately and this has been a great solution. It's already saved me from cleaning up several messes in the floor in the two weeks we've been using it. I took the advice of other users and ordered the Depends Guards for Men to use with this and they fit perfectly inside and have been great with absorbency.
customer_reviews.author: maxava

customer_reviews.title: Our 47 lb bulldog has prostate disease and every so ...
customer_reviews.text: Our 47 lb bulldog has prostate disease and every so often will bleed from it. I decided to try this male dog wrap out as more of a 'band-aid'. I ordered the Large size according to weight but it is a bit too big. If he has it on overnight, it is off by morning. I should have gone with the Medium instead. Overall, it does help catch any drips of blood that come out so it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Jess_Benoit

customer_reviews.title: Great product - already buying more
customer_reviews.text: I bought the medium wrap for my older 25ish lb pug who has started having accidents during the night and when we are gone. The fit is snug enough to stay on, but still seemingly comfortable on my dog. I was worried that it might be too tight and cut off circulation, but my concerns were unfounded. After using this wrap for a couple of months, I just purchased 2 more to have on hand so I don't run out between washes.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Sizing chart is not for dachshunds
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions and ordered the Small. It was way too big, so I'm ordering the X-Small. I'll return to review it if it works. I think it will work in the smaller size, and the seams on the side seem like it will give our dog the comfort he lacks in the other belly band we tried. A note on sizing doxies - in the past I've never gone wrong by following the size chart (ex Puppia harnesses) even with the odd shape of the doxie body, which is the basis for my 3-star rating. Exchanges are a hassle and it seems the sizing chart is universally off on this product description.
customer_reviews.author: chemdaxs

customer_reviews.title: We liked the denim ones better
customer_reviews.text: I liked these better when they were denim. Now they are a knit material that doesn't seem as sturdy and doesn't look like it will wear as well, hard to be sure of that. It may be the cotton wore out faster. I use these for my disabled corgi by cutting a Poise pad in half and then overlapping the two halves in the belly band. Works pretty well though the medium (which fits his waist) is narrower than the two Poise pads. The velcro is still good even in one I have that is so worn it has holes in it. The elastic has not fared as well and several have lost their elasticity after numerous washes.
customer_reviews.author: B. J. Mayer

customer_reviews.title: Helps with a difficult problem
customer_reviews.text: One of my male dogs suddenly started marking in the house. We could never catch him in the act, but he was leaving his marks all over the place. It's very frustrating! We had him tested and he had a urinary infection, so we don't know if it's that or a behavioral thing (he often has anxiety). We're working on getting to the cause, but in the meantime, This wrap saves us from constantly cleaning up pee. He's a 19 lb. cairn terrier and it fits him perfectly. I can't say that HE loves it, but that's life. I hate cleaning pee, so he's got to wear the wrap until we can get him to stop.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy that can really save your carpets or furniture!
customer_reviews.text: Look too small when we received it, but it's very stretchy and after a few hours my dog didn't seem to even notice it. In fact, when he doesn't have it on and I pick it up, he starts jumping up and down like he's excited to put it on haha. I would recommend buying multiples though if your dog has accidents often so that you can have a different one to put on while washing the others.
customer_reviews.author: CodyBur

customer_reviews.title: This needs to be plastic on the outside
customer_reviews.text: The only problem with this item is that the urine soaks through it and when the dog lays down, the urine can get on your carpet. If you put a pad on the inside, it helps but the pad gets bunched up and the urine runs into the inside padding which will then absorb through to the outside. I think this problem would be alleviated entirely if the outside material was some sort of plastic. It's still a good concept and seems to work. The ribbing stays in the place and the dogs (we have two boys) generally won't remove it so that tells me it's pretty comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Uly Pittman

customer_reviews.title: Great way to ease your mind when visiting
customer_reviews.text: Work really well. I usually put a pad in and then don’t need to wash as often. I use them when we go visiting and don’t need to worry if my male dogs get the urge to mark. Just don’t trust them.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: works great- runs a bit large
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a very bad, good boy. He has some behavioral issues, mostly stemming from his insecurity - small dog syndrome. Whenever I leave him alone in the house, regardless of how many walks and trips to the bathroom he's made, he finds some secret reserve of urine to mark my possessions. This is the only thing that has worked! The sizing seems a little large, my dog is a terrier/chihuahua mix - about 23lbs, and its kinda loose. Fortunately, he doesn't usually spray that much so I don't have to use the maxi pads. Works so well I'm going to get some for my boyfriends potty training puppy!
customer_reviews.author: Zoey Belladonna

customer_reviews.title: Great Dog Diapers
customer_reviews.text: I have a older dog that has alot of accidents and these are my go to. They work great and machine washable. I have bought quite a few and will continue to.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Worked for my dog
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dog as he was having separation anxiety while we were moving. I use it as-is with no pads inside. He peed in it once and it held the pee. It washed and dried in the dryer just fine. He is a corgi around 35 pounds and the large works for him. He could wear one a little smaller but I didn't want it too tight. He is able to get it off by sliding off the couch.
customer_reviews.author: My Name Is

customer_reviews.title: It's an Okay Product
customer_reviews.text: I use this, but it's too easy for the dog to maneuver out of. If I put the Washable Cover Ups over it, it'll stay. But it's not staying too well because little Casper defeats me at every turn!!! Don't know as I'll need these much longer as I taught him to use a "Ring for Service Bell" to ask to go outside and now I hear him when he wants to go out. Took me less than five minutes (two trips out with me acting the fool) before he started using the bell... I just set it on the floor beside the door and he "rings" for service....
customer_reviews.author: KarinTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my heeler mix and, although it does what it's supposed to, for the most part, it rubbed against his "inner thigh/groin" area and chafed it pretty good. He only wore it only for a few hours while I ran some errands. I check it, it didn't seem too tight and my dog isn't that big around, he's actually pretty slim-waisted. Maybe it was user error, but I stopped using it as I didn't want to cause him pain.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Trie

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for my aging dog.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an aging Rat Terrier. He weights about 13 lbs and is fairly thin around his waste. The wrap fit around him, but it did not stay flat. It ended up looking like a thin head band with his thing pinched in the middle. Maybe he needs a size larger, but in reading all of the reviews, this appeared to be the right size. I do not use it and didn't return it because I did try to use it for one night. I had no issues with the company. It was shipped promptly.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Zillick

customer_reviews.title: The snug fit did not shift up or down like other throw again doggie wraps
customer_reviews.text: I have a sneaky dog who likes to mark he's territory and this washable wrap came in handy. Unlike doggie diapers, where you need a hole to put there tail through, which seem to aggravate them more. This simple wrap just goes around the lower half over the private area and velcros on and off for ease of removal. The snug fit did not shift up or down like other throw again doggie wraps. Thank you for the simple solution!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Shorticy

customer_reviews.title: good solution for male incontinence
customer_reviews.text: I use these male wraps for two of my pugs. My 15 year old pug forgets where he is supposed to go to the bathroom. My 8 year old pug likes to mark. If you don't wrap it tightly, it can leak. However, they wash well (I air dry them) and it's better than using disposable diapers. Neither of my pugs mind wearing one. You do have the option of inserting a sanitary pad into the wrap, which would improve absorbtion, but I have not tried that.
customer_reviews.author: PugMom Quilts!

customer_reviews.title: 14 yr old dog- marks everywhere!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed. I actually purchased a second one, in case one needs to be laundered. Dog has only marked while wearing this sling one time, so it has been a great deterrent. Dog actually doesn't mind the sling any more, and expects it when he comes in from outside. Now he can roam the house, without me watching him like a hawk. Should have searched this out 2 years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Mahalla

customer_reviews.title: Great for axious dogs who go even if they just went
customer_reviews.text: I have a 8 yr old that, though he gets walked mid day piddles when I or the dog walker leaves the house no matter how much he goes outside. this has not only saved my floor and couch but my condo from smelling. ( I would recommend buying child's diapers and using them as well.. or you can by multiple of these; the diaper gets a few usages)
customer_reviews.author: Lula Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Not very absorbent.
customer_reviews.text: I have this on my 11 year old Siberian husky who's recently become incontinent overnight. He weighs 70lbs. He's peed in this twice. The first time, he flooded it and it made a mess everywhere. The second time, he peed less and it still leaked in smaller puddles around the room. I will continue to use it but it would really be better for a dog who is just "leaking" a little urine. Will also look for some kind of highly absorbent insert to put in there.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine J Reilly

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: This seems to work well when I use it to cover the male diaper. I read reviews where people say that it leaves marks or cuts off circulation on their dogs. I do not have that issue maybe because my dog just barely falls into the large size and it is not too tight. I can say that this along with a diaper have definitely saved me some headache and frustration. Before this I was cleaning up pee from my dog daily. The last thing I want is to be frustrated with my dog who cannot control his bladder in his old age. Thank you for making a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: D954

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: We have a small dog that has always like to mark his territory these are life saver. We place a disposable maxi pad in them and wash them as directed but I do add white vinegar to remove urine odor during wash.
customer_reviews.author: April D Lambert

customer_reviews.title: So far it's working
customer_reviews.text: I have a rescue animal who has no interest in being house broken. He knows he is not supposed to pee in the house, and is incredibly sneaky, so we never catch him. He is about 20lb and this fits very well. He just tinkles on everything, not full blown urinating, so i haven't needed to add any pads. So far, it seems to keep him from tinkling at all. I was about to give up on him after he tinkled on my guitar for the second time, but this diaper is so far saving our furniture, and his welcome at our home.
customer_reviews.author: Miss D

customer_reviews.title: Great solution, better than disposable dog diapers.
customer_reviews.text: When my dog became "leaky" I would use the disposable dog diapers which are like Pampers. But they took a lot of work. This washable wrap takes much les time. As other people here, I found the Simple Solutions disposable pad to be inadequate. So I've been using overnight menstrual pads, though I just read another review by someone using "Poise" pads made for human female incontinence. Note: if you wash the wrap with other clothes as I did with sweaters, the Velcro can attach to the other garment and pull yarn off a sweater. Now I make sure to close the Velcro before washing and drying.
customer_reviews.author: TLD

customer_reviews.title: Guaranteed to Help
customer_reviews.text: This is the best thing to keep Sherlock from running our floors. Our rescue dog doesn't seem to realize inside vs outside, so this wrap works out well. A "Poise" superabsorbent pad cut in half, on top of a piece of one of the floor pads that turn liquid to gel, and Sherlock is beloved in our house. He doesn't mind it at all. It will shift about if your dog is rolling around active, but it works very well and serves the purpose. Thanks so much!
customer_reviews.author: P. Hayson

customer_reviews.title: It looked very painful. I suggest the Teamoy brand instead
customer_reviews.text: Worked OK at first but you have to make sure it’s on tight enough so your dog doesn’t slip out. Because of this, it started chaffing my dogs skin near his hips/belly. It looked very painful. I suggest the Teamoy brand instead, also on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: karen

customer_reviews.title: Another great way to keep a good dog happy.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Mini-Dachshund, male. I have always had girl little dogs. I also have a large one for my male, German Shepherd. I highly recommend these wraps for males still in potty training, or naughty markers. My Dachshund is 12 pounds, 1 yr old, and the fit is snug. I originally bought the medium, which was too large. I kept it because I can just hand sew a seam and make it fit. Best purchase I have made in my 50 years as a dog owner.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Hoppe

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: We add a femine hygenie pad to it and works great with our dog with Cushing"s diease. Through in washer and comes out great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I never thought that I would ever use something like this, or that it would even work
customer_reviews.text: I never thought that I would ever use something like this, or that it would even work. After exasperating all of my methods to get my male Boxer to stop marking in the house, this was my last resort. Low and behold, I found a product that actually works! The only downside is that after you use it once, it needs to be washed as it is not capable of holding of much urine.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: I recommend the bigger padded versions over this brand.
customer_reviews.text: Medium is too small for a 34-lb bulldog with 18-19" waist. He's actually pretty tiny and has a small waist. The elastic is rough and can cause belly rawness. The padding is only minimal compared to the 3-pack padded version floating around Amazon. I use size large for our dog. If you have a bigger dog, go bigger.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Stopped urine marking
customer_reviews.text: This wrap saved my sanity. I recently took in a dog who wants to urine mark inside my house. Just putting the wrap on him has stopped him from doing it. The wrap is a little big for a blue heeler mix (I'm guessing around 40 lbs), but that's my fault for not buying the right size. He does try to take it off at first, but after a minute he leaves it alone. I can't comment on how absorbent it is since he's not incontinent, but this thing has worked perfectly for what I bought it for. I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: lstrl0308

customer_reviews.title: He is 30-35lbs and the medium fits him perfect. She has has wonderful luck with these
customer_reviews.text: My sisters Boston terrier has been having trouble peeing in her house so I got him these to see if they would help cut down on accidents. He is 30-35lbs and the medium fits him perfect. She has has wonderful luck with these. She lines them with cheap maxi pads not the tiny liners this brand sells(I bought some of those too and they are a joke). These wash and dry very well. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: wfz7960

customer_reviews.title: Male Wrap
customer_reviews.text: My little dog is a rescue from the spca. He is 4 years old and had a poor start in life. He is having trouble holding his urine while I am at work even though I have a dog walker to come and walk him during the day. My home was beginning to smell of urine pretty badly. The dog walker suggested this wrap. I have 3 of them now and love them. I put a sanitary pad inside to collect the urine and keep him dry. Then when soiled, I throw them in the washer and dryer and they clean up beautifully. My dog and I are both happy. I would recommend this product for urine problems in dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Sallie M. Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Product
customer_reviews.text: This wrap works so well. I'm certain dog doesn't like it but it fits well and doesn't inhibit the dog from moving around. He and the dog who doesn't pee in the house play somewhat aggressively and the wrap doesn't move. My furniture, trash can, anything accidentally left on the floor have not stopped thanking us for making him wear it. Sure it's and extra step, but worth it for the lack of pee smell in the house.
customer_reviews.author: HERMANSYO

customer_reviews.title: It seemed like more hassle than it was worth
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to make him want to pee more? How's that possible? I bought these to bridge the gap for my bloodhound that wanted to make the inside of the house a pool of urine....but, getting this on him was hilarious, and then the process of taking it off of him, outside, could cause him to spray us. It seemed like more hassle than it was worth. So I bought two of these, used them for like a day, and then he was house trained.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Buley

product_meta.title: Simple Solution Washable Male Dog Diapers | Absorbent Male Wraps with Leak Proof Fit | Excitable Urination, Incontinence, or Male Marking | 1 Reusable Dog Diaper Per Pack
product_meta.description:
Size:MediumIt can be difficult managing a pet with urinary incontinence. Simple Solution Washable Male Wraps will protect your home from pee and restore peace of mind for you and your male dog. 
The super absorbent microfiber pad at the core of these diapers trap in moisture, while the stretchy waistband, and repositionable, Fur-Friendly Fastners provide a secure fit for the wiggliest of dogs.
feature_bullets: IMPROVED SIZING GUIDELINES – Please refer to the new and improved size guideline chart for optimal fit. Simple Solution Male Wraps (size: SMALL) are best for dogs with a waist size range of 20 to 22 Inches. Please measure your dog's waist at the base of the back legs to ensure a proper fit.

LOCKS IN MOISTURE - The super absorbent core of these diapers lock in moisture, while the stretch waistband allows even the wiggliest of boy dogs to move around while staying dry. Plus, the leak-proof liner protects his skin and coat.
DON’T GET STUCK - With our Fur-Friendly Fasteners, your male dog's fur won’t get stuck to the folds of the wrap, which makes attaching and removing the wrap safe and easy.
USEFUL AND VERSATILE - Made for male dogs that are house training or who experience excitable urination, incontinence, or male marking issues. Makes traveling with such a dog way less stressful.
SECURE AND CASUAL - These belly bands provide superior mobility for your little guy, which keeps him relaxed and safe from messes. For female dogs, try our Simple Solution Washable Female Diapers.
